Evaluate $\displaystyle \int_0^1 \tan^{-1} x \ dx$
sols:
From now on, we will use $\displaystyle \arctan x$ instead of
$\displaystyle \tan^{-1} x$. By integration by parts, set
$\displaystyle u = \arctan x$ and $\displaystyle dv = dx$. Then
$\displaystyle du = \frac{1}{1+x^2} \ dx$ and $\displaystyle v = x$.
Then

\begin{align*}
\int_0^1 \arctan x \ dx &= x\arctan x \big|_0^1 - \int_0^1 \frac{x}{1+x^2} \ dx \\
&= \arctan(1)-\frac{1}{2}\ln|1+x^2|\big|_0^1 \\
&= \frac{\pi}{4}-\frac{1}{2}\ln 2\end{align*}
hints:
This is a special integration by parts. Note that another notation for
$\displaystyle \tan^{-1}x$ is $\displaystyle \arctan  x$
